intro: Koeleria pilatii, commonly known as the Tibetan grass, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Koeleria pilatii is adapted to cold and arid environments, often growing in rocky or alpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of mountainous ecosystems.
